page.title: 08Pollution/Kirtlebridge
page.content: A local man who claims that his village is 'under siege' by a local broiler house firm is to raise a petition which will be presented to the local M.P. Sir Hector Munro. The protest is against the siting of ten broiler houses next to the A74 at the Braes Farm, Kirtlebridge. The planning application by the firm who already operate four broiler houses in the area was approved despite objections from ten local residents. It is maintained that the broiler houses already give off dust and noxious fumes in the mild weather and a further ten houses would only increase the problem. The question of road safety was also stressed and the danger of slow-moving lorries and tractors entering the A74 trunk road would cause a traffic hazard.
